introduction.content: Welcome to the MedRecPro Privacy Policy. This document describes how MedRecPro ('we', 'us', or 'our') handles your Personal Data when you interact with our pharmaceutical labeling management platform and related services (collectively, 'Services'). MedRecPro is committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your information in compliance with applicable data protection laws.

sections.heading: 1. Data Controller
sections.content: MedRecPro operates as the Data Controller for Personal Data processed through our Services. For questions about data processing or to exercise your privacy rights, contact our Data Protection Officer at privacy@medrecpro.com.

subsections.content: If your employer, healthcare organization, or pharmaceutical company provides your MedRecPro account, they assume the role of Data Controller for most Personal Data used in our Services. In such cases, MedRecPro functions as a Data Processor, adhering to the Data Controller's instructions. Please refer to your organization's privacy policies for additional information.
When we provide training, consulting, or implementation services, the data protection terms in your service agreement govern the processing of your data.

sections.heading: 2. Personal Data We Collect
sections.content: The Personal Data we collect depends on how you interact with our Services, including which features you use and how you access them.

subsections.content: We collect information you provide directly, including:

items.description: When you create an account, we collect your name, email address, and profile information provided by your authentication provider (Microsoft, Google, or Apple).
Optional information you provide such as professional title, organization name, pharmacy license numbers, or other professional credentials.
Pharmaceutical labeling documents, SPL files, annotations, notes, and other content you upload or create within the Services.
Information you provide when contacting customer support, including descriptions of issues, screenshots, and communication history.
Information you submit through surveys, feature requests, or interactive feedback mechanisms.
For paid subscriptions, billing details including name, billing address, and payment method information processed through our payment provider.

subsections.content: When you use our Services, we automatically collect certain information:

items.description: Data about your interactions with the Services, including IP address, device information, browser type, session details, date and time of requests, pages viewed, features used, and search queries.
Operating system, device type, device identifiers, screen resolution, and application version.
Approximate geographic location based on IP address to provide region-appropriate services and comply with jurisdictional requirements.
Server logs that record your access to the Services, including timestamps, referring URLs, and actions performed.
Information about service performance, error reports, and diagnostic data to maintain and improve the Services.

subsections.content: We may receive information about you from third-party sources:

items.description: When you authenticate using Microsoft, Google, or Apple, we receive your name, email address, and profile information as permitted by your settings with those services.
We may collect publicly available professional information such as pharmacy license verification data from state boards of pharmacy.
If you are part of an organization account, administrators may provide information about you for account management purposes.

sections.heading: 3. How We Use Your Information
sections.content: We process your Personal Data for the following purposes:

subsections.content: To provide, maintain, and improve our pharmaceutical labeling management Services, including processing SPL documents, managing labeling workflows, and delivering personalized experiences.
To authenticate your identity, authorize access to features based on your role and permissions, maintain session security, detect and prevent fraud, abuse, and security threats.
To send service-related notifications, respond to support requests, provide updates about features or policy changes, and deliver information you have requested.
To analyze usage patterns, identify accessibility gaps, troubleshoot issues, and improve the Services' functionality, performance, and user experience.

When you use AI-powered features, your queries and relevant document content may be processed by third-party AI services (such as Anthropic's Claude) to generate responses and analysis. We do not use your content to train AI models.
To comply with applicable laws, regulations, and legal processes, including FDA regulations, healthcare data requirements, and responding to lawful requests from authorities.
To conduct billing, accounting, capacity planning, and other business operations necessary to provide the Services.

sections.heading: 4. SPL Data Processing
sections.content: MedRecPro is designed to process pharmaceutical labeling data in compliance with FDA and HL7 specifications.

subsections.content: You retain full ownership of all SPL documents, labeling content, and related data you upload or create through the Services. MedRecPro processes this data solely to provide the Services you request.

We process SPL data according to FDA Structured Product Labeling specifications and HL7 standards. Our processing supports, but does not replace, your organization's regulatory compliance obligations.
While we strive for accuracy in rendering and processing SPL data, you remain responsible for verifying the accuracy of pharmaceutical labeling content before submission to regulatory authorities.
MedRecPro is not designed to process Protected Health Information (PHI) as defined by HIPAA. Do not upload patient-identifiable health information to the Services.

sections.heading: 5. Sharing of Personal Data
sections.content: We may share your Personal Data with the following categories of recipients:

subsections.content: We engage trusted third-party service providers to perform functions on our behalf, including cloud hosting (Microsoft Azure), content delivery (Cloudflare), authentication services, payment processing, and analytics. These providers are contractually obligated to protect your data and use it only for the services they provide to us.
When you use AI-powered features, relevant data is processed by Anthropic's Claude API. Anthropic's data processing is governed by their privacy policy and our data processing agreement with them.

If you use MedRecPro through an organization account, your organization's administrators may have access to your account information and usage data as permitted by your organization's agreement with us.

We may disclose Personal Data when we believe in good faith that disclosure is necessary to comply with applicable laws or legal processes, protect the rights, property, or safety of MedRecPro, our users, or the public, or detect, prevent, or address fraud, security, or technical issues.

In the event of a merger, acquisition, reorganization, or sale of assets, your Personal Data may be transferred as part of that transaction. We will notify you of any such change and the choices you may have regarding your data.
We may share your Personal Data with other parties when you explicitly consent to such sharing.

sections.heading: 6. Data Storage and Security
sections.content: We implement comprehensive security measures to protect your Personal Data.

subsections.content: Your data is stored securely on Microsoft Azure infrastructure in the East US 2 region. Azure maintains SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001, and other security certifications.
We implement encryption at rest using AES-256 encryption for stored data and encryption in transit using TLS 1.2 or higher for all data transmission.

We employ role-based access controls, secure authentication mechanisms, and the principle of least privilege to limit access to Personal Data to authorized personnel who require it for legitimate business purposes.
We conduct regular security assessments, maintain security logs and monitoring, implement secure software development practices, and promptly address identified vulnerabilities.

We maintain incident response procedures to detect, respond to, and recover from security incidents. In the event of a data breach affecting your Personal Data, we will notify you and relevant authorities as required by applicable law.

sections.heading: 7. Data Retention
sections.content: We retain your Personal Data for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this Privacy Policy.

subsections.content: We retain your account information for as long as your account remains active. Upon account deletion, we will delete or anonymize your Personal Data within 90 days, except where retention is required for legal obligations or legitimate business purposes.
User-uploaded documents and content are retained until you delete them or request account deletion. Deleted content may be retained in backups for up to 30 days.
Service usage logs and analytics data are typically retained for up to 24 months for service improvement and security purposes, then deleted or anonymized.
We may retain certain data for longer periods when required by law, to resolve disputes, enforce our agreements, or protect our legal rights.

sections.heading: 8. Your Privacy Rights
sections.content: Depending on your location, you may have specific legal rights regarding your Personal Data.

subsections.content: Subject to applicable law, you have the right to:

items.description: Request access to the Personal Data we hold about you.
Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete Personal Data.
Request deletion of your Personal Data, subject to certain exceptions.
Receive your Personal Data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format.
Request restriction of processing of your Personal Data under certain circumstances.
Object to processing of your Personal Data for certain purposes.
Where processing is based on consent, withdraw that consent at any time.

subsections.content: To exercise your privacy rights, contact us at privacy@medrecpro.com. We will respond to your request within the timeframe required by applicable law (typically 30-45 days). We may need to verify your identity before processing your request.
You can access, update, and manage much of your account information directly through your account settings in the Services.
If we deny your rights request, you have the right to appeal that decision. We will provide you with information on how to submit an appeal at that time.

sections.heading: 9. Lawful Bases for Processing (EEA, UK, and Switzerland)
sections.content: If you are located in the European Economic Area (EEA), United Kingdom, or Switzerland, we process your Personal Data based on the following lawful bases under the GDPR:

subsections.content: Processing necessary to perform our contract with you, including providing the Services, managing your account, and delivering features you request.

Processing necessary for our legitimate interests, including improving the Services, ensuring security, conducting analytics, and communicating with you, provided these interests are not overridden by your data protection rights.
Processing necessary to comply with applicable laws and regulations.
Where required by law, we will obtain your consent before processing your Personal Data. You may withdraw consent at any time.

sections.heading: 10. International Data Transfers
sections.content: MedRecPro is based in the United States, and your Personal Data may be transferred to and processed in the United States and other countries where our service providers operate.

subsections.content: When we transfer Personal Data from the EEA, UK, or Switzerland to countries not recognized as providing adequate data protection, we rely on appropriate safeguards such as Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission.
We are committed to complying with applicable data transfer requirements and protecting your Personal Data regardless of where it is processed.

sections.heading: 11. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
sections.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to provide and improve our Services.

subsections.content: We use essential cookies for authentication, session management, security, and core functionality. These cookies are necessary for the Services to function and cannot be disabled.

We may use analytics cookies to understand how users interact with the Services, identify usage patterns, and improve functionality. You can opt out of analytics cookies through your browser settings.
We do not use advertising or third-party tracking cookies. We do not sell your Personal Data or share it for targeted advertising purposes.
You can manage cookie preferences through your browser settings. Note that disabling essential cookies may affect the functionality of the Services.
We honor Do Not Track (DNT) signals sent by your browser. When we detect a DNT signal, we will not set non-essential cookies.

sections.heading: 12. Third-Party Services
sections.content: Our Services integrate with or link to third-party services. This Privacy Policy does not apply to third-party services, and we encourage you to review their privacy policies.

subsections.content: We use Microsoft, Google, and Apple for authentication. Their privacy policies govern their collection and use of your data: Microsoft Privacy Statement (https://privacy.microsoft.com), Google Privacy Policy (https://policies.google.com/privacy), Apple Privacy Policy (https://www.apple.com/legal/privacy/).
Our Services are hosted on Microsoft Azure. Microsoft's privacy practices are governed by the Microsoft Privacy Statement and applicable data processing agreements.
AI-powered features are provided through Anthropic's Claude API. Anthropic's privacy policy (https://www.anthropic.com/privacy) governs their processing of data.
We use Cloudflare for DNS management and content delivery. Cloudflare's privacy policy (https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/) governs their data processing.

sections.heading: 13. US State-Specific Information
sections.content: This section provides additional information for residents of US states with specific data privacy laws.

subsections.content: If you are a California resident, you have additional rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA):

items.description: You have the right to request information about the categories and specific pieces of Personal Data we have collected about you.
You have the right to request deletion of your Personal Data, subject to certain exceptions.
You have the right to request correction of inaccurate Personal Data.
We do not sell your Personal Data or share it for cross-context behavioral advertising.
We will not discriminate against you for exercising your privacy rights.

subsections.content: Residents of Virginia, Colorado, and Connecticut have similar rights to access, correct, delete, and port their Personal Data, as well as the right to opt out of targeted advertising, sale of Personal Data, and profiling. You also have the right to appeal our decision regarding a rights request.

In the past 12 months, we have collected the following categories of Personal Information: identifiers (name, email address, IP address), professional information (job title, organization), internet activity information (usage data, log data), and geolocation data (approximate location based on IP address).

To exercise your rights under state privacy laws, email privacy@medrecpro.com or submit a request through your account settings. You may also designate an authorized agent to make requests on your behalf.

sections.heading: 14. Children's Privacy
sections.content: MedRecPro is designed for professional use and is not intended for individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect Personal Data from minors. If you become aware that a minor has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us at privacy@medrecpro.com, and we will take steps to delete such information.

sections.heading: 15. Changes to This Privacy Policy
sections.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, technologies, legal requirements, or other factors. If we make material changes, we will provide notice through the Services or by other means (such as email) at least 30 days before the changes take effect. Your continued use of the Services after the effective date of the updated Privacy Policy constitutes your acceptance of the changes.

sections.heading: 16. Contact Us
sections.content: If you have questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us:
